name: Pulled Pork Nachos
description: [Photograph: Joshua Bousel] When it comes to nachos in my house, Texas-style is the type that flies. My Texan-bred wife brought the superiority of these nachos to my attention years ago. Each chip is individually topped then baked, ensuring you...

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Fill a large skillet with about 1 inch of vegetable oil. Heat oil to 375 degrees over medium-high heat. Working in batches, fry the quartered tortillas until lightly browned, about 1 to 2 minutes of the first side, then an additional 30 to 60 seconds on the other side. Remove to a paper towel lined plate and season with salt.
Arrange chips on a baking sheet in a single layer. Drop a rounded tablespoon of pulled pork on each chip. Top the pulled pork with about 1 tablespoon of barbecue sauce, then sprinkle with cheese.
Bake chips until cheese is melted, about 5 to 10 minutes. Serve immediately.
